title: No Wandb logging
body:
### Search before asking

- [x] I have searched the RF-DETR issues and found no similar bug report.


### Bug

- pip install "rfdetr[metrics]"
- wandb login -> success
- Ensure the PROJECT is created on wandb

```python
PROJECT = "my_project"

model.train(
    dataset_dir=dataset.location, 
    epochs=15, 
    batch_size=4, 
    grad_accum_steps=4, 
    lr=1e-4,
    wandb=True,
    output_dir=output_dir,
    project=PROJECT,
    run="some_name",
)
```
No errors, but no logs on wandb

### Environment

- rfdetr==1.0.8
- wandb==0.19.9

### Minimal Reproducible Example

see above

### Additional

_No response_

### Are you willing to submit a PR?

- [ ] Yes, I'd like to help by submitting a PR!
author: robmarkcole

comments.body: Your RF-DETR package is outdated. Please use 1.1.0.

OK resolved with 1.1.0.
Strange I got 1.0.8 as I pip installed yesterday
Thanks!

satisfaction_conditions: A solution that enables Wandb logging functionality to work properly
Information about using the correct version of the RF-DETR package
Clear guidance on how to resolve the issue without requiring code changes to their implementation

_classification.category: Can be dockerized without any issue

dockerfile:
FROM python:3.9-slim

# Set environment variables
ENV PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE=1
ENV PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1

# Install system dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
    git \
    build-essential \
    ffmpeg \
    libsm6 \
    libxext6 \
    cmake \
    && apt-get clean \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Create working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Clone repository and checkout specific commit
RUN git clone https://github.com/roboflow/rf-detr.git . \
    && git checkout 5e2979d55e2aab0da80bd8a8ca8cf09c6f4ab909

# Upgrade pip first
RUN pip install --no-cache-dir --upgrade pip

# Install torch separately to ensure compatibility
RUN pip install --no-cache-dir torch torchvision

# Install project with metrics dependencies
RUN pip install --no-cache-dir -e ".[metrics]"

# Install wandb explicitly to ensure correct version
RUN pip install --no-cache-dir wandb==0.19.9

# Set the working directory to the project root
WORKDIR /app

# The container is now ready for the user to run their code
CMD ["bash"]
